headline: John Beilein protege named head coach of Wayne State men's basketball
author: Tony Paul
sentences: And, as an aside, after 105 years, and recognizing all the great basketball student-athletes who have played for Wayne State over the years, including four former members of the Harlem Globetrotters and current New York Knicks GM Scott Perry, it is good to see one of our own direct the program."

I have followed Bryan's career, first as a student-athlete when he was our captain and led us to a championship, and then as he has progressed under the direction of such accomplished basketball coaches as David Greer, John Beilein, and Greg Paulus.

A Pontiac native who played high-school ball at Pontiac Northern, Smothers played at Wayne State from 2007-11, and became the second player in program history with 1,100 points, 300 assists and 300 rebounds (Art Johnson was the other).

As a senior, he was first-team all-Great Lakes Intercollegiate Athletic Conference, and was GLIAC tournament Most Valuable Player after leading Wayne State to its first Division II NCAA Tournament appearance since 1999.
